currentPost.title: Don’t Do Today’s Job with Yesterday’s Tools Part I
currentPost.excerpt: For any medical practice trying to set up and maintain a website, it can be overwhelming to find all the [ More.. ]
currentPost.content:
For any medical practice trying to set up and maintain a website, it can be overwhelming to find all the necessary tools for the job. In an online market with multiple products available, there are numerous situations in which professionals invest in an online tool and are unsure of how to truly utilize it. For instance, having a tool that identifies effective keywords is only effective when someone knows how to apply those results to the website.

Fortunately, Doctor Genius has the knowledge necessary to utilize specific online tools to help get your professional website more traffic. This 5-part blog series summarizes a few of the tools that we employ in our packages.

SEO Keywords

The basic function of a professional website is to advertise a service or group of services in order to reach consumers. The effective method for keeping people on a website is to provide content covering services or related topics. However, there are thousands of resources online that can appear higher up on a Google search over our clients. Thus, we insert SEO keywords into text that will help the website appear higher up the search list.

Call Tracking

For many private medical practices, having a working phone number is an important part of the appointment process. No matter how much information is on a website, there is always a need for patients to call the office. However, professionals do not keep track of all phone calls and what source generated them. A call tracking system can measure which ads or web pages are bringing in the greatest amount of traffic. This way, we can shift focus from one aspect to another.

The Pew Research Center states that at least 77 percent of U.S. adults own a smartphone.

Overloading a Website with Content

While it is important to have content on a website, simply flooding a website with content or copying more content onto a website will cause issues instead of benefits. Along with that is the fact that content needs to include topics and keywords that can help boost Google search list rankings.

Mobile First vs. Mobile Responsive

A mobile first website is when we create the mobile version of a website so that it appears on a phone screen without causing other issues. After creating the website for phones and tablets, we will then create the website for the desktop, as well. This way, you can have a website that appears properly on all devices without cutting off page content or causing other issues.

Doctor Genius

We will also be offering a chance to win a 75” flat screen TV, Google Home Max, and various other prizes with any demo completed at our booth. The latest tools of the trade

Partnering with Doctor Genius allows clients to put a strong foot forward with a professional, mobile-first website. Our Doctor Genius Team utilizes key marketing techniques to extend our client’s reach online which is consistently maintained and audited through our proprietary software, also known as our Doctor Genius Client Portal.

While we are available over the phone, we are also located locally in Irvine, CA. Our area of expertise lies in dominating local markets all while attracting new business to help sustainably grow your private practice on and offline.

Doctor Genius is a Google Premier Partner that provides clients with all-inclusive packages that reach, engage and convert consumers into patients.

Stop by and give us a visit

No matter the skill of a professional in any field of dentistry, advanced tools and equipment can help make any dental procedure a breeze. The CDA hosts such an event in which there are a variety of booths offering the latest technological achievements for dentistry on the market.

One tool that will help professionals attract and retain new patients is online marketing. For more information on our booth location at the CDA event or more information on our online services, give us a call today. We hope to see you there.

nextPost.title: Oh The Places They’ll Go: The Potential Patient’s Online Journey
nextPost.excerpt: The goal of a website for any private practice is to accurately summarize the services of a practice and offer [ More.. ]
nextPost.content:
The goal of a website for any private practice is to accurately summarize the services of a practice and offer patients easy means of reaching your practice to schedule an appointment. The journey of the potential patient usually begins with an internet search that factor in online reviews, what insurance guidelines the patient has to follow and geographical location. If a website does not cater to those search parameters, then the website will have trouble attracting a steady flow of new patients.

Understanding the patient’s journey

It is important to understand the mindset of the potential patient who is in need of dental care. While advertising specific types of services on a website can be beneficial, professionals need a website that can effectively display those services in an easy-to-navigate manner. Patients need to feel that they can trust what the website states to a certain degree. Thus, reviews about the medical practice hold a certain amount of influence over people.

For instance, Ryan Erskine highlights statistics in a Forbes article, which states that 90 percent of consumers read online reviews before visiting a business. While people may be able to sense when a review is fake or the individual is over exaggerating, there are still many people who trust reviews to a certain degree. Thus, having a website that links to reviews and having professionals recommend patients leave reviews will help to promote their practice.

While reviews are an important part of what people consider when searching for a practice, location also influences where they will go. Many people will merely type in the name of their city and the type of care they need to start the search. Fortunately, Doctor Genius can help ensure that a specific practice appears within the different map apps and for the search phrase, “City, Dentist.”

The Forbes article adds that 91 percent of adults use search engines online to find information on the web.

Proper website presentation

In order to stand out among the masses on Google search results, professionals need a quality website service that continues maintenance and updates to the website. Doctor Genius does both of these things and more, applying skills and necessary tools to the foundation of the website. At Doctor Genius, we build a website with the potential patient’s focus in mind. We know where to place the correct terms, information and content people want immediately.

Our team understands that when people are considering calling a medical practice, they are searching for the surface level of information. After finding the basic information, patients may begin to look at the rest of the website to find quality content that breaks down the practice’s services. While each patient is different, there tends to be a similar search routine for medical care. Insurance also plays a significant role in selecting a medical practice. We can help the professional determine how much or little about the subject they want to place on their website.

Call us for more information today.
